meanings.definition: The total amount resulting from the addition of smaller amounts.
meanings.sent1: After adding up all the prices, the subtotal came to $50.
meanings.sent2: The subtotal of my grocery bill was $30 before taxes.
meanings.sent3: The subtotal of the bill made me realize I had spent too much on desserts.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement reached a subtotal when she saw the final bill for the shopping spree.
meanings.sent5: The subtotal on the receipt showed the cost of the items before discounts were applied.

meanings.definition: To calculate the subtotal of a list of numbers.
meanings.sent1: I need to subtotal the expenses before submitting the report.
meanings.sent2: She quickly learned how to subtotal figures in the spreadsheet.
meanings.sent3: Trying to subtotal the long list of expenses felt like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The accountant will subtotal the costs to determine the budget allocation.
meanings.sent5: Remember to subtotal each section before moving on to the next step in the calculation process.
